lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's adapted from the Duke project. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Kleb.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Kleb.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
* The main class for the Kleb chatbot application.
* It initializes the application and runs the main command loop.
* Constructs a new Kleb instance, initializing UI, storage, and task list.
* Attempts to load tasks from filePath, otherwise creates an empty list.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Starts the main application loop to handle user input and commands.
* The loop terminates on 'bye' and saves tasks after modifications.

mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event, delete, find, list, bye""");
* The main entry point of the Kleb application.
* Represents an exception thrown when a date-time string does not match the expected format.

Uh-oh! Your command's format is incorrect. Format:

Uh-oh! Your command's format is incorrect. Format:

* Handles all user interface interactions for the application.
* This includes displaying messages, logos, and getting user input.

* Prints the application's ASCII art logo to the console.
* Prints an error message indicating the save file is corrupted.
System.out.println("Save file corrupted, starting app with empty list.");
* Prints the initial greeting message to the user.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the exit message to the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Gets the next line of input from the user via the parser.
* Manages loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Handles file and directory creation if they do not exist.
* Constructs a new Storage instance from a full file path.
* It separates the directory and the file name from the path string.
* @param pathString The full path to the save file.
* Combines the directory and file name to get the full path.
* Reads all lines from the save file into a list of strings.
* Creates the directory and file if they don't exist.
* @return A list of strings representing the saved tasks.
* Writes a list of task strings to the save file, overwriting existing content.
* @param saveList The list of strings to save.

* @param by The deadline for the task.

* Represents an abstract task with a description and a completion status.
* This is the base class for ToDo, Deadline, and Event tasks.

System.out.println("Uh-oh! Enter a number within the list.");
* Marks a specific task as not done based on user input.
System.out.println("Okay! This task has been marked as undone:\n\t" + task);
System.out.println("Uh-oh! Enter a number within the list.");

System.out.println("Added a task to your list:\n\t" + task);
System.out.println(String.format("Now you have %d task(s) in the list.", tasks.size()));

* Contains unit tests for the Deadline class.
* Tests if the toString method formats an undone deadline correctly for display.
* Tests if the getSaveString method formats an undone deadline correctly for saving.
* Tests if the toString method formats a completed deadline correctly for display.
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Project", true, by);
* Tests if the getSaveString method formats a completed deadline correctly for saving.
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Project", true, by);
* Contains unit tests for the Event class.
* Tests if the toString method formats an undone event correctly for display.
Event event = new Event("Vacation", from, to);
String expected = "[E][ ] Vacation (from: Sep 01 2025 1300 to: Sep 05 2025 1930)";
* Tests if the getSaveString method formats an undone event correctly for saving.
Event event = new Event("Vacation", from, to);
* Tests if the toString method formats a completed event correctly for display.
Event event = new Event("Vacation", true, from, to);
String expected = "[E][X] Vacation (from: Sep 01 2025 1300 to: Sep 05 2025 1930)";
